channel.title: The English We Speak on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in The English We Speak on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Touch grass | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you spend too much time online? Here's an expression you can use to say 'take a break'. Transcript

item.title: I'm out | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes you need to say you don't have anything left. Learn 'I'm out'. Transcript

item.title: Plan b | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you need an alternative option, you need to know this phrase. Learn how to use it. Transcript

item.title: Sound out | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes you just want to find out what someone else thinks. Transcript

item.title: Fly by night | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When companies or people can't be trusted, use this expression. Transcript

item.title: One-up | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you want to beat your friends by saying what you have done that is better than them? Transcript

item.title: Tread on someone's toes | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description It can be annoying when someone does something you were supposed to do. Transcript

item.title: Mental gymnastics | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description How do we talk about complicated tasks done by your brain? Transcript

item.title: Call dibs | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to get the last slice of pizza, what can you say? Transcript

item.title: Run for the hills | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What makes you want to run for the hills? Transcript

item.title: Each to their own | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description How do you feel when someone does something that you would never do, but it’s OK? Transcript

item.title: Fill your boots | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you are presented with an opportunity, how can you tell some to take advantage? Transcript

item.title: Join the club | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description How to tell someone that the bad situation they are experiencing is the same as yours. Transcript

item.title: Go with the flow | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to say that you are happy to do what other want to do Transcript

item.title: Cakeism | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about wanting to have two good things at the same time. Transcript

item.title: Drip feed | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about giving information little by little. Transcript

item.title: Scatterbrain | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn about this word that describes someone disorganised or forgetful. Transcript

item.title: Be in with a shout | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase for winning! Transcript

item.title: On point | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase all about being perfect! Transcript

item.title: Kiss something goodbye | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description An expression with ‘kiss’ that’s not about kissing! Transcript

item.title: Productivity theatre | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about pretending to work. Transcript

item.title: Pet hate | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to describe your annoyance Transcript

item.title: On the table | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase often used in business. Transcript

item.title: Jump through hoops | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about the challenge of getting something done. Transcript

item.title: It happens to the best of us | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When someone makes a mistake, learn what to say to make them feel better. Transcript

item.title: Famous last words | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase about telling someone they’ll be wrong. Transcript

item.title: Hard pass | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about saying ’no’ firmly. Transcript

item.title: Level up | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Level up’ your English and learn a new word! Transcript

item.title: Get with the programme | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an idiom used to encourage someone to accept new ideas or techniques. Transcript

item.title: Shout-out | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to praise or thank someone publicly. Transcript

item.title: Fitspiration | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Get fit with this new word! Transcript

item.title: Hats off | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about impressing people. Transcript

item.title: Under your breath | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Make sure you’re heard with this expression. Transcript

item.title: Be at a loss | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression for when you’re not sure what to say or do in a certain situation. Transcript

item.title: Go off on one | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an informal expression about becoming suddenly very angry. Transcript

item.title: Wiggle room | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase for when you need to change a budget to do something else. Transcript

item.title: (It's the) story of my life | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase you can use to describe a bad situation. Transcript

item.title: No ifs or buts | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Stop making excuses and learn this expression! Transcript

item.title: Caught red-handed | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression about being caught doing something wrong. Transcript

item.title: Rabbit on | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about talking too much. Transcript

item.title: Thanks a bunch | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When does ‘thanks’ not mean ‘thanks’? Find out about an ironic English phrase. Transcript

item.title: Slow walk | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description How do you describe something making slow progress? Transcript

item.title: Take something to heart | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about taking advice or criticism personally and very seriously. Transcript

item.title: Take something to heart | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If someone takes something to heart, what does it mean? Transcript

item.title: Know the score | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about understanding the situation. Transcript

item.title: Jog your memory | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about remembering. Transcript

item.title: A flying start | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression we use to say a new task is going very well. Transcript

item.title: Steal someone's thunder | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you get more attention than someone else, what are you doing? Here’s a useful phrase! Transcript

item.title: Call it a day | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase about doing enough Transcript

item.title: Off the top of my head | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When you don’t have the facts and figures at hand, you have to make a quick guess. Transcript

item.title: Change for the better | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you want to make a positive change for 2023? We have an expression for you to learn. Transcript

item.title: The gift that keeps on giving | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about receiving presents. Transcript

item.title: Quiet quitting | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about just doing enough. Transcript

item.title: Hang in there | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Times can be challenging but don’t give up. We have a phrase to spur you on. Transcript

item.title: Bite your tongue | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What does ‘bite your tongue’ mean? Transcript

item.title: Win hands down | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description An easy phrase for an easy win! Transcript

item.title: Fever pitch | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description The men’s football World Cup is coming, and excitement has reached fever pitch! Transcript

item.title: Twiddle your thumbs | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase for boring times. Transcript

item.title: Get your act together | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase about good organisation. Transcript

item.title: Dog's dinner | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn this phrase to describe a complete mess. Transcript

item.title: Sitting pretty | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to describe a good situation. Transcript

item.title: Feast your eyes | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes you can be amazed at what you see. Learn an expression for these moments. Transcript

item.title: Put the brakes on | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about stopping or slowing down an activity. Transcript

item.title: Second-guess | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you don’t know what’s going to happen next, you have to guess. Transcript

item.title: Ins and outs | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn about a new expression and why Feifei gets a shock! Transcript

item.title: Yes and no | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Not all answers in life are ‘yes’ or ’no’. Learn why with this phrase. Transcript

item.title: Eat your words | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about being wrong. Transcript

item.title: Bug someone | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes people or things just annoy you. Learn a phrase about this. Transcript

item.title: Willy-nilly | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an informal expression about doing things without planning. Transcript

item.title: Willy-nilly | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A random phrase Transcript

item.title: Gnarly | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you find something disgusting? Use this word to describe it. Transcript

item.title: Smash it | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to give encouragement Transcript

item.title: A doddle | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Is this phrase easy to learn? Transcript

item.title: It’s now or never | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to use ‘it’s now or never’ Transcript

item.title: Happy days | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to use when you hear good news. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about extra effort. Transcript

item.title: Game face | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression about determination. Transcript

item.title: Bitten by the bug | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about becoming interested and excited in doing something. Transcript

item.title: It escapes me | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase about forgetting something Transcript

item.title: Onboarding | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Starting a new job means becoming familiar with new duties! Transcript

item.title: Thereby hangs a tale | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When there is more to say…. Transcript

item.title: The royal treatment | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Are you ready to feel like a king or a queen? Transcript

item.title: Tell me about it | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes people say something that you can’t help but agree with. Learn a new phrase. Transcript

item.title: Creatively bankrupt | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you ever feel like your creativity just vanishes? Here’s a phrase for that situation. Transcript

item.title: As if | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase to use when someone says something that is ridiculous or blatantly untrue. Transcript

item.title: Bad hair day | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description How are you looking today? Could you be having a bad hair day? Transcript

item.title: 'Ish' - The English We Speak | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Make the English you speak sound more natural Transcript

item.title: Promises, promises | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a new expression about not believing someone’s promises. Transcript

item.title: Not see hide nor hair | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes it’s impossible to find someone. Here’s a phrase to use in this situation. Transcript

item.title: A curate's egg | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an odd expression which means something is a little good but mainly bad Transcript

item.title: That'll be the day | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about things that are unlikely to happen. Transcript

item.title: Gathering dust | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What’s gathering dust in your house? Transcript

item.title: Easier said than done | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Talking about doing things can be easy, but doing them can be a bit more complicated. Transcript

item.title: The plot thickens | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase for when a situation becomes more mysterious. Transcript

item.title: All at sea | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Discover more about this nautical phrase in The English We Speak. Transcript

item.title: Don't mind me | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you want tell someone to ignore what you’re doing, what can you say? Transcript

item.title: Cramp my style | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Who’s cramping your style? Transcript

item.title: You couldn't make it up | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression for unbelievable events. Transcript

item.title: Cool cat | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know someone who is really hip and trendy? Transcript

item.title: There's nothing to it | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes we do things that are simple. Learn an ’easy’ phrase to describe this. Transcript

item.title: As sick as a parrot | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about disappointment. Transcript

item.title: Eke out | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description We have the perfect phrase to describe making the most of what you’ve got left. Transcript

item.title: Say no more | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about understanding someone. Transcript

item.title: Scrub up well | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about making a special effort to dress smartly. Transcript

item.title: You shouldn't have | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to show surprise when receiving a gift Transcript

item.title: Not looking too clever | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If someone’s ’not looking too clever’, are we doubting their intelligence? Transcript

item.title: Not like the sound of something | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Don’t like what you hear? Say it with this expression! Transcript

item.title: I'll give you that | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn what to say when you agree with someone about some or all of what they said. Transcript

item.title: Another string to your bow | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about having an additional skill. Transcript

item.title: Clap back | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When someone criticises something you’ve done, what do you do? Transcript

item.title: Talk through your hat | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about talking nonsense. Transcript

item.title: Quote ... unquote | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description An expression for when we want to repeat exactly what someone has said. Transcript

item.title: Not a patch on something | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression for when something is far worse than something else. Transcript

item.title: No cap | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know someone who always tells the truth? Transcript

item.title: Moreish | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description An expression you can use to talk food you can’t resist. Transcript

item.title: A legend in one's lifetime | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know a famous living person? Here’s a phrase to describe them. Transcript

item.title: Live rent-free in one's head | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What or who do you think about all the time? Transcript

item.title: Now you're talking | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to show that you like someone’s idea. Transcript

item.title: Hits different | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Here’s the expression you can use to talk about something special. Transcript

item.title: Extra | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression to describe how exaggerated some people are. Transcript

item.title: Zhuzh | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you want to make something more interesting by changing it slightly? Transcript

item.title: Lo and behold | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression to introduce a surprising part of a story. Transcript

item.title: Bigwig | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Here’s an expression to describe an important and powerful person. Transcript

item.title: Cringe | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A word for when you want to say that something is really embarrassing. Transcript

item.title: It’s the … for me | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression to talk about why you love or hate something. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Some things are obvious but maybe this word isn’t. Listen to the programme. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description If there is something you are interested in doing now, we have an expression for you. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Learn a new meaning of the word ‘savage’. Transcript

item.title: Lit | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an informal word to say something is amazing. Transcript

item.title: Yikes! | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an informal word to express shock. Transcript

item.title: YOLO | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you live for the moment? Transcript

item.title: Vibe | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to say something has a good aura, we have an expression you can use. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Do you know what to call someone who’s new to something or very inexperienced? Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Learn a word to describe behaving like an adult. Transcript

item.title: Push back | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about delaying things. Transcript

item.title: The CEO of | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to say you’re the best at something, you could use this expression! Transcript

item.title: Zip it! | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description We all like to talk, but some people don’t know when to stop. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description What do you call a job badly done? Transcript

item.title: It slaps! | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What do you think is absolutely amazing? Transcript

item.title: Have a lot of plates spinning | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A phrase about having a lot of things to do. Transcript

item.title: Pizzazz | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do a lot of people remark on how glamorous you are? Transcript

item.title: Oomph | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A word to describe someone with charm and energy! Transcript

item.title: Snap up | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you snap up something, you get it quickly or immediately and usually with enthusiasm. Transcript

item.title: Nothingburger | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Describing something insignificant Transcript

item.title: Awesomesauce | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a new informal word to describe something amazing. Transcript

item.title: Clout | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression about having influence. Transcript

item.title: GOAT | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description ‘GOAT’ is used to talk about things or people that we think are the best. Transcript

item.title: Workation | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Workation’ is a combination of the words ‘work’ and ‘vacation’. Transcript

item.title: Moonshot | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression used to describe an experimental project. Transcript

item.title: Slap-bang | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to describe an exact position. Transcript

item.title: Sadfishing | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A word used when someone exaggerates their emotional problems to get attention. Transcript

item.title: Mic drop | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Roy and Feifei teach you a new English expression. Transcript

item.title: Tone deaf | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn when ’tone deaf’ has nothing to do with music… Transcript

item.title: 'A' game | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes people need to be on top form and do their best work. Transcript

item.title: Frontliner | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description We describe nurses and doctors who have been working on the frontline Transcript

item.title: On fleek | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description From eyebrows to clothes, when they look good we like to say so. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Learn vocabulary related to the coronavirus pandemic. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Someone who has become more important than ever during the coronavirus pandemic. Transcript

item.title: Sharenting | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Don’t share too many photos of your children! Transcript

item.title: Plastic footprint | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description It’s similar to ‘carbon footprint’, but this focuses on your plastic usage. Transcript

item.title: Spoiler alert! | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A warning when we’re going to reveal part of the story of a film, book or TV series. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Find out more about a portmanteau that combines the words ’list’ and ‘article’. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Learn a word about the addiction to looking at depressing news on social media. Transcript

item.title: Crowdsourcing | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a word that might be useful when you’re developing an idea and need help. Transcript

item.title: One step at a time | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description When you’re trying something new, it’s best not to rush. Transcript

item.title: Bog-standard | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description How do you describe something that is standard, ordinary and nothing special? Transcript

item.title: A wake-up call | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn this expression: it’s a warning sign! Transcript

item.title: Climate emergency | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Find out more about this expression and learn things you can do to help the planet. Transcript

item.title: Thirsty | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A word for social media attention-seekers! Transcript

item.title: Vanilla | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a word that can be used to describe something that is basic or bland. Transcript

item.title: Roast | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn the other meaning of the word ‘roast’. Transcript

item.title: Sticking point | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A ‘sticking point’ is an issue or a problem in a negotiation that blocks an agreement. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Learn language to talk about the coronavirus pandemic. Transcript

item.title: Living in a bubble | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know someone who’s a bit sheltered from the problems of the world? Transcript

item.title: Cancelled | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn the new meaning of the word ‘cancelled’. Transcript

item.title: New normal | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a new expression that describes our new way of life. Transcript

item.title: Slippery slope | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to describe a situation that is getting worse and might end in disaster. Transcript

item.title: Throw shade | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression about criticism. Transcript

item.title: Bite the bullet | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an English expression with bite! Transcript

item.title: Blended working | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A mix of home and office working has led to a new English expression. Transcript

item.title: JOMO | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever felt like turning off your phone and not doing something social? Transcript

item.title: Furlough | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Not a new word, but it’s more commonly used recently due to the coronavirus crisis. Transcript

item.title: Spill the tea | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Are you a gossip? You’ll love this expression. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description What word can you use to describe people who show off? Find out with Roy and Feifei. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Why are people saying ‘salty’? Find out with Feifei and Roy. Transcript

item.title: Skeleton crew | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description An expression for when there aren’t many people working. Transcript

item.title: Lowkey | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description A word used to describe something you love doing, but are embarrassed to tell people. Transcript

item.title: Live for something | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase for things that excite you! Transcript

item.title: Cabin fever | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Some people suffer from this experience.Find out what it means. Transcript

item.title: Bang on about something | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know someone who talks about something so much that it gets annoying? Transcript

item.title: Fire | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone knows what fire is, don’t they? Think again! Roy and Feifei teach a new meaning. Transcript

item.title: Running on fumes | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What can you say when you have no energy? Learn a new English expression! Transcript

item.title: Sheeple | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Follow the crowd and learn a new English expression! Transcript

item.title: Hater | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase to describe a negative attitude. Transcript

item.title: Talk shop | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you have to talk about work even when you’re not doing it, this is the phrase for you! Transcript

item.title: Snackable | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an expression to describe short online content that you can snack on! Transcript

item.title: A memory like a sieve | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Are you forgetful? This expression is for you! Transcript

item.title: Nomophobia | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Got a fear of not using your mobile phone? Here’s how to describe your condition. Transcript

item.title: Peacocking | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Rob and Feifei explain the true meaning of this animal-related phrase. Transcript

item.title: Kick into the long grass | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to delay doing something, where do you kick it?! We have the answer here. Transcript

item.title: Rat race | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description The Year of the Rat is here – so Neil has decided to dedicate his life to work. Transcript

item.title: Microworker | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description What’s a ‘microworker’? May be you are one! Transcript

item.title: Serial returner | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn a phrase about exchanging clothes. Transcript

item.title: Talk the talk | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Neil can talk the talk, but does he know what he’s talking about? Transcript

item.title: Out with the old, in with the new | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description As 2020 approaches, learn a phrase to describe what you can do at this time of year. Transcript

item.title: The more the merrier | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Christmas and time to party. Learn a phrase that means more people equals more fun! Transcript

item.title: Take one for the team | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Are you the kind of person who makes sacrifices for others? Transcript

item.title: Mind your Ps and Qs | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Learn an English expression about being polite. Transcript

item.title: Dad dancing | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Swing those arms, shake those hips! Is this the latest dance trend? Transcript

item.title: Big data | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Big data’ is a hot term these days, but do you know what it means? Learn here. Transcript

item.title: Punch above your weight | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description It sounds violent, but this phrase might surprise you! Transcript

item.title: A thing | The English We Speak
item.description: Podcast Description Beards have been ‘a thing’ for a while. Is it now time to shave them off? Transcript
